title: Perfect set
summary: In general topology, a subset of a topological space is perfect if it is closed and has no isolated points. Equivalently: the set S {\displaystyle S} is perfect if S = S ′ {\displaystyle S=S'} , where S ′ {\displaystyle S'} denotes the set of all limit points of S {\displaystyle S} , also known as the derived set of S {\displaystyle S} .
